## Public Static Functions

### writeIndirectStubsBlock() {#a9303a767476d5b470bd5fd9b6f3fb737}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void llvm::orc::OrcRiscv64::writeIndirectStubsBlock (char &#42; StubsBlockWorkingMem, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/executoraddr">ExecutorAddr</a> StubsBlockTargetAddress, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/executoraddr">ExecutorAddr</a> PointersBlockTargetAddress, unsigned NumStubs)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Write NumStubs indirect stubs to working memory at StubsBlockWorkingMem.

Stubs will be written as if linked at StubsBlockTargetAddress, with the Nth stub using the Nth pointer in memory starting at PointersBlockTargetAddress.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/orcabisupport-h/#l00372">372</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/orcabisupport-h">OrcABISupport.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/executionengine/lib/executionengine/orc/orcabisupport-cpp/#l01040">1040</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/executionengine/lib/executionengine/orc/orcabisupport-cpp">OrcABISupport.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### writeResolverCode() {#ad01a5083eaf1e3d159f353bef7ff9547}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void llvm::orc::OrcRiscv64::writeResolverCode (char &#42; ResolverWorkingMem, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/executoraddr">ExecutorAddr</a> ResolverTargetAddress, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/executoraddr">ExecutorAddr</a> ReentryFnAddr, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/executoraddr">ExecutorAddr</a> ReentryCtxAddr)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Write the resolver code into the given memory.

The user is responsible for allocating the memory and setting permissions.

ReentryFnAddr should be the address of a function whose signature matches void&#42; (&#42;)(void &#42;TrampolineAddr, void &#42;ReentryCtxAddr). The ReentryCtxAddr argument of writeResolverCode will be passed as the second argument to the function at ReentryFnAddr.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/orcabisupport-h/#l00356">356</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/orcabisupport-h">OrcABISupport.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/executionengine/lib/executionengine/orc/orcabisupport-cpp/#l00917">917</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/executionengine/lib/executionengine/orc/orcabisupport-cpp">OrcABISupport.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### writeTrampolines() {#ab3c54bf4c1a9c329326a4b6dfb7b52ff}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void llvm::orc::OrcRiscv64::writeTrampolines (char &#42; TrampolineBlockWorkingMem, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/executoraddr">ExecutorAddr</a> TrampolineBlockTargetAddress, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/executoraddr">ExecutorAddr</a> ResolverFnAddr, unsigned NumTrampolines)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Write the requested number of trampolines into the given memory, which must be big enough to hold 1 pointer, plus NumTrampolines trampolines.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/orcabisupport-h/#l00364">364</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/orcabisupport-h">OrcABISupport.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/executionengine/lib/executionengine/orc/orcabisupport-cpp/#l01017">1017</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/executionengine/lib/executionengine/orc/orcabisupport-cpp">OrcABISupport.cpp</a>.
